content: my very own pompurin this is the first pattern that i ve made so let me know if you catch any mistakes/have any questions thank you so much for downloading this pattern and i hope you enjoy your very own pompompurin tag me in photos of what you created or contact me on instagram @ atoz_mystery you are free to sell them just please give me credit *note i forgot to count what row the arms/legs/tail goes but i approximate the placement in the assembly section *see end of instructions for larger photos materials ● yellow yarn- i used sweet snugglestm by loops and threads in the color daffodil bulky soft yarn ● brown yarn- the yarn i used is medium non-fuzzy/thick and is thinner than the yellow yarn ● crochet hook - i used a 8 mm crochet hook for the yellow yarn and a 5 mm hook for the brown yarn ● stitch marker ● scissors ● tapestry needle ● stuffing and lots of it ● brown felt and fabric glue ● row counter may be helpful abbreviations ● single_crochet= single_crochet ● increase= increase two single crochets in one stitch ● double_crochet= decrease ● r= round ● * how many times you will do the stitches in the parentheses ● the numbers in the parentheses after each line let you know how many stitches you should have in that round instructions *you will create each part and then assemble at the end body ● r1 8 single_crochet in magic_ring 8 use a stitch marker to keep track of your first stitch ● r2 increase all of the stitches 16 ● r3 single_crochet increase *8 24 ● r4 2 single_crochet increase *8 32 ● r5-r7 single_crochet in each stitch for the next three rounds 32 ● r8 3 single_crochet increase *8 40 ● r9 4 single_crochet increase *8 48 ● r10-r12 single_crochet in each stitch for the next three rounds 48 ● r13 5 single_crochet increase *8 56 ● r14-r19 single_crochet in each stitch for the next six rounds 56 ● start stuffing the body ● r20 5 single_crochet double_crochet *8 48 ● r21 4 single_crochet double_crochet *8 40 ● r22-r30 single_crochet in each stitch for the next eight rounds 40 keep stuffing the body ● r31 3 single_crochet double_crochet *8 32 ● r32 2 single_crochet double_crochet *8 24 ● r33 1 single_crochet double_crochet *8 16 ● r34 double_crochet *8 8 before closing stuff the body until it is full he should be round and chunky especially towards the bottom ● cut the yarn and leave a few inches for the tail pull the yarn through the loop on your hook put the yarn in the needle thread the extra yarn through the front loops of the eight stitches and pull tight to close ears x2 ● r1 8 single_crochet in magic_ring 8 ● r2 single_crochet increase *4 12 ● r3 2 single_crochet increase *4 16 ● r4 3 single_crochet increase *4 20 ● r5-r8 single_crochet in each stitch
